intro: Rubus watheletii, commonly known as the Wathelet’s blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly found in Georgia and South Carolina. This shrub typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and produces small, dark purple berries. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces white to pale pink flowers in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
